name: NewYorker
text: In the past, a historically unpopular President plummeting in the polls would have caused panicking politicians to distance themselves, @sbg1 writes. But the vast majority of Republicans are not abandoning Donald Trump. https://t.co/7MkpPa3T1D

text: It is human nature to react to a moral decay by creating new institutions, the plague scholar Gianna Pomata says. Could COVID-19 create an opportunity for profound social change?  https://t.co/VRqP38crQP

text: Robert Mueller declined to issue a grand-jury subpoena for Donald Trump’s testimony, and he excluded from his report a conclusion that Trump had committed crimes. These decisions are the most revealing features of Mueller’s tenure, @JeffreyToobin writes. https://t.co/CWeZs9DB9x

text:

text: At first, the debate over Section 50-A, which blocks the release of police disciplinary records, was largely waged among criminal-justice-system insiders. That changed in July, 2014, when a plainclothes officer killed Eric Garner.  https://t.co/TiDIfAGa8m
